intro: Elatostema stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Elatostema stenocarpum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open woodlands and heathlands.
